intro: Megastachya ciliata, commonly known as the silky beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually pink to purple in color, bloom in late summer and are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is relatively drought-tolerant and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
